hypothesis: Stale-age trigger (session gap > 3 between lane filing and resolution) achieves >=80% recall with <20% false-positive rate for identifying lanes that needed intervention (ultimately ABANDONED), outperforming blocked-tag, missing-next-step, and low-churn triggers.
method: Parsed 428 unique lanes from SWARM-LANES.md + SWARM-LANES-ARCHIVE.md (283 MERGED, 140 ABANDONED, 5 ACTIVE). Treated ABANDONED as positive class (lane needed intervention). Evaluated 4 trigger bundles: (1) blocked-tag: blocked field != none, (2) stale-age: notes contain 'stale'/'superseded'/'no execution', (3) missing-next-step: next_step absent or =none, (4) low-churn: progress field absent. Computed recall, precision, and false-positive rate for each trigger independently and a combined (>=2/4) policy.

blocked_tag.verdict: Very high precision but nearly zero recall. Blocked tag is rarely applied, so it catches almost nothing. Useful as a high-confidence signal but not as a primary trigger.

stale_age.verdict: BEST trigger. 97.1% recall with only 5.3% FPR. Staleness is the dominant signal for lanes needing intervention. Exceeds the 80% recall / <20% FPR prediction.

missing_next_step.verdict: Perfect recall but coin-flip precision. Missing next_step catches everything but fires on 53% of healthy lanes too. Useful as pre-filter only.

low_churn.verdict: Worst trigger. Low-churn flag correlates with healthy merged lanes (many MERGED lanes lack progress= fields). Inverted signal.

combined_2_of_4.verdict: Higher recall than stale-age alone (+1.4pp) but much worse FPR (36% vs 5%). The combination degrades performance because missing-next-step and low-churn inject noise.

finding: Stale-age is the single best helper-trigger policy: 97.1% recall, 90.0% precision, 5.3% FPR. This confirms F-HLP1's prediction that staleness-based triggers outperform metadata-based triggers. The blocked-tag trigger has the highest precision (75%) but near-zero recall because few lanes use the blocked field. The recommended policy is: stale-age as primary trigger, blocked-tag as high-confidence supplement.
iso_mapping: ISO-10 (predict-error-revise): each trigger bundle is a prediction of intervention need; diff against actual outcomes (ABANDONED vs MERGED) drives policy selection. ISO-13 (integral windup): stale lanes accumulate without discharge, same mechanism as helper queue backlog.
next_steps: Implement stale-age trigger as automated helper-dispatch policy in maintenance.py (already partially exists as check_swarm_lanes stale detection)
Test whether combining stale-age + blocked-tag improves over stale-age alone on future lane data
Advance F-HLP2: test whether helper handoff contracts (explicit next_step + artifact refs) reduce recovery latency for stale-detected lanes
